Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Get AssertionFailedError when assert from
another thread.

I think I understand what is taking place. An assertion is being made,
but it's not actually being run inside the JUnit framework. Nathan said

that he starts a thread and the thread then calls update which
presummably runs some of these assertions. Note that the thread is not
actually being run in the JUnit context, so any errors thrown by it
simply bubble up and halt the framework.

My suggestion, if this is the case, is to run the thread, then query the

thread from your Test and run the assertions in the test.

public void testThread() {
YourThread t = new YourThread();
t.start();
t.join();
assert("thread isn't in correct state", t.state() ==
EXPECTED_STATE);
}

-shane
